channel.title: JBoss Issue Tracker
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [ENTESB-1873] SSH host.key regeneration each start
item.description:
This problem seemed to be fixed in other issues.
But somehow it is not.

LOG:

10:24:04,118 | INFO  | b]-nio2-thread-1 | ServerSession                    | 60 - org.apache.sshd.core - 0.12.0 | Server session created from /127.0.0.1:33931
 
10:24:04,165 | WARN  | b]-nio2-thread-1 | SimpleGeneratorHostKeyProvider   | 60 - org.apache.sshd.core - 0.12.0 | Unable to read key /home/pklimczak/Services/jboss-fuse-6.2.0.redhat-016/etc/host.key: java.lang.ClassNotFoundException: org.bouncycastle.jcajce.provider.asymmetric.dsa.BCDSAPrivateKey
 
10:24:04,169 | INFO  | b]-nio2-thread-1 | SimpleGeneratorHostKeyProvider   | 60 - org.apache.sshd.core - 0.12.0 | Generating host key...

SSHD Core still do not import proper package.

Apache Mina SSHD :: Core (60)

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.

comments.comment:
To solve this problem permanently I can see only 2 solutions:
1. Use BouncyCastle as a default library and load it with JBoss Fuse as a system library
2. Amend SSHD-Core to optionally import (long list here) or dynamically import org.bouncycastle.*

As JBF is already using BC library, why not to make it a system library?
That will solve this problem once for ever!

All we need to do to solve this problem is simply to:

1. Add bcprov-jdk15on-1.49.jar to ${karaf_home}/lib/ directory
 
2. Add at the end of "org.osgi.framework.bootdelegation=....." a value: ",org.bouncycastle*"

Done.
Problems solved once for ever!
Can we do this?

Please also note, that https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/KARAF-3064 has not solved this problem, because in 6.2.0.redhat-016 we are using mvn:org.apache.sshd/sshd-core/0.12.0 and problem still occurs.
It is probably same problem, but not fully solved?

Hi Piotr,

Yeah, this seems not fixed for Fuse 6.2. I was quite sure it worked for me when I tested it a few months ago but maybe it only worked on plain Karaf. Will look into fixing this for 6.2 (probably by a new release of SSHD).

Thanks,
Jon

Hi Jonathan!

Thanks for the answer!

If you are able to release SSHD then great.
I've seen there are wildcards in pom.xml imports (in SSDH project). As you know wildcards are not enough for regular import directive (not dynamic one), because if required class is not explicitly used in code, then its package will not be added to final manifest file.
So you have to explicitly list all possible packages, which SSHD need to use.
It may not be easy to know all of them, so I suggested to consider making BC as a system library or use dynamic imports but only for base BC package.

Greetings
Peter
Dup of ENTESB-1531

customfieldvalues.customfieldvalue: Download latest release, login by SSH, restart, login by SSH again.
